I'm disappointed to see you releasing this as an app, especially after saying "Free, educational content to people everywhere". This content should be made available as widely as possible, not just people with App-store-enabled phones and tablets. Building this sort of resource using open web standards would ensure it was truly "Free educational content for everyone" that could be accessibly on practically every device imaginable, and not subjected to the whims of app store conditions and smart phones. You've hamstrung yourself and limited the audience, and since you're not doing this as a for-profit exercise, the "benefits" of locking yourself down to the walled-garden of phone ecosystems are non-existent.

I know you've already done a lot of work to create this (and it looks great, aside from this fundamental flaw), but I hope you reconsider this decision and make this resource truly available to everyone, everywhere, using open web standards.
